    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract ID<K,V> getName()
        Specified by:
        getName in class IndexExtension<K,V,FileContent>

      • getInputFilter

        public abstract FileBasedIndex.InputFilter getInputFilter()
        Returns:
        filter for file are supposed being indexed by the IndexExtension.getIndexer(). Usually DefaultFileTypeSpecificInputFilter can be used here to index only files with given file-type. Note that check only file's extension is usually error-prone way and prefer to check VirtualFile.getFileType(): for example user can enforce language file as plain text one.

      • dependsOnFileContent

        public abstract boolean dependsOnFileContent()

      • indexDirectories

        public boolean indexDirectories()

      • getCacheSize

        public int getCacheSize()
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_CACHE_SIZE

      • getFileTypesWithSizeLimitNotApplicable

        public java.util.Collection<FileType> getFileTypesWithSizeLimitNotApplicable()
        For most indices the method should return an empty collection.
        Returns:
        collection of file types to which file size limit will not be applied when indexing. This is the way to allow indexing of files whose limit exceeds PersistentFSConstants.getMaxIntellisenseFileSize().

        Use carefully, because indexing large files may influence index update speed dramatically.

      • keyIsUniqueForIndexedFile

        public boolean keyIsUniqueForIndexedFile()

        public boolean traceKeyHashToVirtualFileMapping()

      • hasSnapshotMapping

        public boolean hasSnapshotMapping()

      • needsForwardIndexWhenSharing

        public boolean needsForwardIndexWhenSharing()
        Whether this index needs the forward mapping to be shared along with inverted index. If this method returns false, it is an error to call FileBasedIndex.getFileData(ID, VirtualFile, Project) for this index.
